params.taskDescription: Carolyn is breeding two pea plants, and notes that 8 of the 25 offspring plants have yellow peas. So, she concludes that there’s a 32% chance that an offspring of these two plants will have yellow peas.

params.taskDescription:
If you roll three standard 6-sided dice, the probability that the sum will be 8 is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>21</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>216</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{21}}{{216}}</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Jim and Anne are both in a club with 10 members. If 3 people are chosen at random to form a committee, then the probability that both Jim and Anne are chosen is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mn>1</mn>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>15</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{1}{{15}}</annotation></semantics></math>.

questionSetStimulus: In the following Exercises, decide whether the given probability was likely determined theoretically, empirically, or subjectively.
